intro: Echites cururu var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed echites, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
